name: Finder
description: Provides addresses of the live contracts implementing certain interfaces. Examples of interfaces with implementations that Finder locates are the Oracle and Store interfaces.

functionDecorators.name: changeImplementationAddress
functionDecorators.description: Updates the address of the contract that implements `interfaceName`.

parameterDecorators.name: interfaceName
parameterDecorators.description: bytes32 of the interface name that is either changed or registered.

functionDecorators.name: getImplementationAddress
functionDecorators.description: Gets the address of the contract that implements the given `interfaceName`.

returnDecorators.description: implementationAddress address of the defined interface.

functionDecorators.name: owner
functionDecorators.description: Returns the address of the current owner.

functionDecorators.name: renounceOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

functionDecorators.name: transferOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
